column4: Where do I copy a firefox theme to? Do I copy the .jar file, or unzip it?
what are the downsides to having an ATI card?
The downside is that you will have either no 3D, or else very buggy drivers that freeze your machine.
The upside is that your card's manufacturer name will be three letters shorter so it doesn't take you so long to type it out when you're here asking for help on it.
Then your monitor will not work.
If it's a modern monitor, it will say "signal out of range".
If it's not, it will explode.
Ok, well the monitor still runs, but I can't get my resolution to work
a) Have you restarted X? b) Do you get any error messages? c) what does your xorg.conf look like?
My monitor works (I'm using it right now), but I can't make my resolution as high as it was on windows
None of which answers any of the three questions I asked you.
Pastebin is a site where you upload text, and then give us the link to the uploaded text so we can read it.
It's a way to "paste" stuff to us without flooding the channel.
Ok.
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/39107/
a) Have you restarted X since changing this? b) How are you trying to change it?
I haven't changed it since I last restarted my computer. I followed a tutorial to add "Modeline", but that was all I edited.
I'm serious. Look, about the sync values: This is one of the more important parts. If you choose incorrectly you could damage your monitor.
From another site:   Be careful not to exceed the specifications of your monitor.  Doing so could damage your hardware.
ok, well I haven't edited those values - But is it possible that they're wrong?
Where did you get them?
The values were already there when I first opened the file.
